A Commissioned Officer O1 is a Second Lieutenant in all US military branches except in the Coast Guard and Navy where it is an Ensign.
A Commissioned Officer O2 is a First Lieutenant in all US military branches except in the Coast Guard and Navy where it is a Lieutenant Junior Grade.
A Commissioned Officer O3 is a Captain in all US military branches except in the Coast Guard and Navy where it is a Lieutenant.
A Commissioned Officer O6 is a Colonel in all US military branches except in the Coast Guard and Navy where it is a Captain.
A Commissioned Officer O4 is a Major in all US military branches except in the Coast Guard and Navy where it is a Lieutenant Commander.
A Commissioned Officer O5 is a Lieutenant Colonel in all US military branches except in the Coast Guard and Navy where it is a Commander.
A Commissioned Officer O7 is a Brigadier General in all US military branches except in the Coast Guard and Navy where it is a Rear Admiral Lower Half.
A Commissioned Officer O9 is a Lieutenant General in all US military branches except in the Coast Guard and Navy where it is a Vice Admiral.
A Commissioned Officer O10 is a General in all US military branches except in the Coast Guard and Navy where it is a Admiral.
Referral to a government (i.e. state and/or federal) assistance program that provide prescription medications to qualified uninsured, low-income patients.

A federal government program that provides reimbursements for nutritious meals and snacks to eligible children and adults who are enrolled at a participating child care, day care home, or adult day care center.
A positive screening is defined as a quantitative score of greater than or equal to 2.
A selective culture media recommended for the isolation, cultivation, and maintenance of fungi and yeasts.
A fixative for preserving fecal specimens for concentration and direct examination.
A medium recommended for the transportation, preservation, and examination of laboratory specimens.
A variety of sauces used as a condiment for tacos and other Mexican and Mexican-American foods, and as dips for tortilla chips.
A solution used in molecular biology to lyse human or animal cells for the extraction of proteins such as DNA and RNA.

The specialty within osteopathic medicine that emphasizes the incorporation of osteopathic manual diagnosis and osteopathic manipulative treatment into the evaluation and treatment of the nervous, muscular, and skeletal systems in their relationships to other systems of the body as well as the whole person.

Thickened, homogenous consistency which holds its shape after serving, and does not separate into liquid and solid components during swallowing, ie. cohesive. .Smooth, moist and cohesive enough to hold its shape on a plate or when scooped. Cannot be poured. Does not spread out if spilled. No chewing required.

A modular formula consisting of the singular macronutrient protein which can be mixed with other modular formula nutrients or nutritionally complete oral or enteral formulas to provide supplemental protein.
Change in provision of the total amount of parenteral formula (PN) delivered per time element (e.g., mL/24 hours).

A modular formula consisting of the singular macronutrient carbohydrate which can be mixed with with other modular formula nutrients or nutritionally complete oral or enteral formulas to provide supplemental carbohydrate.

A modular formula consisting of the singular macronutrient lipid (fat) mixture, typically in the form of highly soluble fats or medium chain fatty acids, which can be mixed with with other modular formula nutrients or nutritionally complete oral or enteral formulas to provide supplemental carbohydrate.

Food is soft, tender and moist. Needs some chewing. Can be mashed with a fork. No seeds, skins, husks, skin, or hard chunks. No sticky, tough, chewy, crunchy or leafy foods. Mashed easily using a fork at the point of consumption.
Containing hard pieces, crust or skin which has formed during cooking/heating/standing. Crunchy, crispy, tough, or dry. Unable to mash with a fork. Hard to chew and swallow.
Foods that stick to the mouth and teeth, for example cheese chunks, peanut butter, and marshmallows. Also, chewy candies such as caramel and licorice.
Honey or milkshake consistency. Cohesive and pours slowly. Possible to drink directly from a cup although fluid flows very slowly.
A tree nut from the butternut tree, Juglans cinerea.
The fruit of the Canarium tree, Canarium indicum.

System(s) for classifying and recording the preferred directions of fascial motion throughout the body.
Body mass index 5 percentile to less than 85 percentile.
A subspecies of the common grey fox found in southern California.
A subspecies of the common grey fox found in Baja California.
A subspecies of the common grey fox found in south-western United States and northern Mexico.
An electromechanical device that sense either static or dynamic forces of acceleration of motion in a single plane (uniaxial) or three orthogonal planes (triaxial).
Post-mortem decomposition fluid commonly found in the mouth and nares of a decedent.

US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) program that offers permanent housing and supportive services to assist homeless people to live independently, but does not limit eligibility to individuations with disabilities or families in which one adult or child has a disability.

US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) program that offers permanent housing and supportive services to assist homeless people to live independently, but does not limit eligibility to individuations with disabilities or families in which one adult or child has a disability.

Assistance with application for US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) program that offers permanent housing and supportive services to assist homeless people to live independently, but does not limit eligibility to individuations with disabilities or families in which one adult or child has a disability.

Assistance with application for US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) program that offers permanent housing and supportive services to assist homeless people to live independently, but does not limit eligibility to individuations with disabilities or families in which one adult or child has a disability.

Education about the US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) program that offers permanent housing and supportive services to assist homeless people to live independently, but does not limit eligibility to individuations with disabilities or families in which one adult or child has a disability.
An osteopathic practitioner-directed inhalation and/or exhalation by the patient to assist the manipulative treatment process.

A self-report instrument developed by Rudolf Moos and colleagues in 1974 to assess the social climates of the family. It focuses on the measurement and description of the interpersonal relationships among family members, on the directions of personal growth which are emphasized in the family, and on the basic organizational structure of the family.

Retail clinics are located inside of large stores, like supermarkets and department retailers and provide walk-in services for patients. Instead of physicians, retail clinics are staffed by nurse practitioners (NPs) or physician assistants (PAs).
A person whose gender identity corresponds with the sex the person had or was identified as having at birth.
A condition in which one is unable to regularly move from place to place in a safe and timely manner because one lacks the resources necessary for transportation.

A group of direct techniques that usually involve lateral stretching, linear stretching, deep pressure, traction and/or separation of muscle origin and insertion while monitoring tissue response and motion changes by palpation.

Subject has no intention to, is unwilling, or has actively refused the opportunity to breast-feed. Concept should not be used to represent a subject that is unable to breast-feed due to a medical or any other type of condition.

A hypothetical functional axis from the superior area of a sacroiliac articulation to the contralateral inferior sacroiliac articulation. It is designated as right or left relevant to its superior point of origin.

A pattern of behavior in any relationship that is used to gain or maintain power and control over an intimate partner or other household members. Abuse is physical, sexual, emotional, economic or psychological actions or threats of actions that influence another person.
Living in an environment that is not meant for permanent human habitation such as cars, parks, sidewalks, abandoned buildings (on the street).

Living in an environment that is not meant for permanent human habitation such as cars, parks, sidewalks, abandoned buildings, or on the street. However, the environment is a designated safe sleeping environment.
Housed with no more than 2 relocations in the last 12 months, current on rent or mortgage, and without housing cost burden or risk of eviction.
A person formally trained in the study of human behavior (both observable physical actions and mental phenomena such as thoughts and emotions) or the application of this knowledge to human health.

A psychologist trained in, or practicing, a model of psychology that emphasizes optimal functioning (facilitating personal growth and development) in contrast to the clinical model of psychology, which emphasizes treating pathology (treating mental disorders). Counseling psychologists receive professional education and training in a variety of areas such as educational, vocational, employee, aging, personal, marriage, or rehabilitation counseling.
A clinical psychologist specializing in the assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of cognitive and behavioral conditions that are the direct result of disorders of the brain.

A person formally trained in the study of the relationship between physiology of the nervous system and human behavior (both observable physical actions and mental phenomena such as thoughts and emotions).

A person formally trained in the study of the relationship between physiology of the nervous system and human behavior (both observable physical actions and mental phenomena such as thoughts and emotions).
A psychologist specializing in understanding how the structure and function of the brain relates to specific psychological processes.
A physician who provides anesthesia for neonates, infants, children and adolescents as well as appropriate peri-operative care, advanced life support, and acute pain management.
A physician with expertise in the laboratory diagnosis of diseases that occur during fetal growth, infancy, and child development.

A psychologist specializing in the study of sleep and sleep disorders or the application of acquired knowledge about sleep and sleep disorders to the assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of sleep problems.
Healthcare workers with specialized knowledge and skills needed to participate on a team providing antithrombotic therapies.

Therapeutic recreation is a specialty that uses recreation and other activity-based interventions, such as arts and crafts, interaction with animals, sports, games, dance and movement, drama, music, and community outings to address the needs of people with physical, mental, or behavioral conditions and to promote psychological and physical health, recovery and well-being.
Patient is self-referred based content in any instrument of communication which may include by is not limited to the internet, newspapers, TV, radio, etc..
Patient is self-referred based content posted on the internet.

The sex designated on a person's birth certificate. Typically, sex is assigned at birth, but some US states, sex may be updated later in life to align with a person's gender identity. The change in legal sex may or may not require that a person has undergone gender affirming, or sex reassignment, surgery.

Tube with K2EDTA (spray-dried) for trace element. Tubes for trace elements are labeled specifically for these purposes on the shelf package and case label. Use only appropriately labeled tubes for these tests.
The actual or perceived availability of informational, emotional, and tangible resources from others meets the individual's needs.
Teaching about programs and services offered at medical centers run by the Veterans Health Administration, part of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.

Sphenoid and occiput have rotated in opposite directions around parallel transverse axes; the basiocciput and basisphenoid are both superior in SBS flexion with an increase in the dorsal convexity between these two bones.

A single segmental dysfunction of the thoracic or lumbar vertebrae. This vertebra is significantly flexed or extended and demonstrates a preference for sidebending and rotation in the same direction (e.g. rotated right and sidebent right or sidebent left, rotated left).

A group dysfunction of the thoracic and lumbar vertebrae. These vertebrae are neutral relative to the sagittal plane and demonstrate a preference for sidebending and rotation in opposite directions, (e.g. sidebent right and rotated left or sidebent left and rrotated right).

Sphenoid and occiput have rotated in opposite directions around parallel vertical axes and rotate in the same direction around an anterior-posterior (A-P) axis. SBS sidebending-rotations are named for the convexity, right or left.
Represents individuals who have developed two or more type 1 diabetes–associated islet autoantibodies but are normoglycemic.
Includes individuals with two or more islet autoantibodies but whose disease has now progressed to the development of glucose intolerance, or dysglycemia, from loss of functional β-cell mass.

Represents manifestations of the typical clinical symptoms and signs of Type 1 diabetes mellitus, which may include polyuria, polydipsia, weight loss, fatigue, diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA), and others.
The finding of alternating fascial motion preference in the direction opposite that of the common compensatory pattern.

A person formally trained in the study of the relationship between physiology of the nervous system and human behavior (both observable physical actions and mental phenomena such as thoughts and emotions).
A mammography report that has been transcribed by a clinician from the original report into an electronic report containing both structured and unstructured content.

Evaluation of eligibility for the US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) program that offers permanent housing and supportive services to assist homeless people to live independently, but does not limit eligibility to individuals with disabilities or families in which one adult or child has a disability.
Forced and/or unwanted sexual interaction (touching and non-touching acts) of any kind by a caregiver or other person in a trust relationship with an older adult.

The intentional use of physical force by a caregiver or other person in a trust relationship that results in acute or chronic illness, bodily injury, physical pain, functional impairment, distress, or death.

Assistance with application for US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) program that offers permanent housing and supportive services to assist homeless people to live independently, but does not limit eligibility to individuals with disabilities or families in which one adult or child has a disability.
Referral to a program that offers instruction in basic skills in the workplace including but not limited to reading, math, technology, or english language skills.

The illegal, unauthorized, or improper use of an older individual's resources by a caregiver or other person in a trust relationship, for the benefit of someone other than the older individual. This includes, but is not limited to, depriving an older individual of rightful access to, information about, or use of personal benefits, resources, belongings, or assets.
Currently housed, but experiencing housing cost burden.

Currently consistently housed but experiencing any of the following circumstances in the last 12 months: behind on rent or mortgage, 3 or more relocations, housing cost burden, homelessness, or risk of eviction.

Teaching about child support, the monthly amount a court orders a child's noncustodial parent to pay the parent with primary custody. It helps pay for a child's needs on a daily basis, from food and housing to clothing and medical needs.
A posterior or backward torsion of the sacrum to the left on the right oblique axis.
A posterior or backward torsion of the sacrum to the right on the left oblique axis.
A anterior or forward torsion of the sacrum to the right on the right oblique axis.
The specific finding of alternating fascial motion preference at transitional regions of the body
